intro: Pycnocoma dentata, commonly known as the toothed pycnocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually narrow and have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Pycnocoma dentata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
